reviewText: This DVD is literally LOADED with footage which covers a four year span from the group's zany early years. It has over 2 1/2 hours of incredible, immature stuff. It also has all music videos from their first cd, as well as a special recording session for "Happy Together". It's amazing. And Pat filmed a lot for the group. He does so much for the group and it really shows with the immature antics of these guys.....it even has special Pat footage....GOD, it's funny!!!!
summary: Wow!! How can I only give this DVD 5????

reviewText: As one of the band members says near the start of the DVD, you know what kind of music they like, you know the sort of things they like to sing about.  This DVD is to give a little insight into the band members.The DVD contains about 2 1/2 hours of following the guys on their travels from recording studio, to tour, to vacation, to tour, and so on.  There's a lot of practical joking, fooling around, the guys acting like guys.  There's a definite feel that the average viewer would fit in real nice with the members of Simple Plan.  The idea is that fame and success hasn't changed them, even if they get to go to faraway countries and stay in nice hotels now.Contains the four Simple Plan music videos, which are nice to have.  The DVD contains a chapter on the making of each one of them, which is interesting to hear about.Perhaps the best bonus is the included CD, "A Small Package for You," which included the new song, "Crash and Burn", as well as live versions of "One Day" and "I'd Do Anything" recorded in Orlando in September.  A few postcards showing scenes from Simple Plan's tour (there's a nice one of them before 60,000 at Giants Stadium) are included.So it's good value for money.  It's a good buy or present for the Simple Plan fan.Enjoy.
summary: Nice to have for the Simple Plan fan!
